text: The prolactin-releasing peptide receptor (PrRPR) also known as G-protein coupled receptor 10 (GPR10) is a protein that in humans is encoded by the PRLHR gene. PrRPR is a G-protein coupled receptor that binds the prolactin- releasing peptide (PRLH). == Function == PrRPR is a 7-transmembrane domain receptor for prolactin-releasing peptide that is highly expressed in the anterior pituitary. ==References== ==Further reading== * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * ==External links== * * Category:G protein-coupled receptors
title: Prolactin-releasing peptide receptor
